rogel.io.fopl

Interface Unifiable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Expression
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Function, Predicate, Term, Variable

    public interface Unifiable
extends Expression
    A Unifiable Object is a logical Expression that can be used in unification.
    Author:
    recardona

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean containsVariable(Variable variable, Substitution substitution)
      Checks to see if this Unifiable expression contains the parameter Variable, given an existing set of Substitutions (which may involve the Variable to check for).
      Substitution unify(Unifiable unifiable, Substitution substitution)
      Attempts to find the Substitution that unifies (makes syntactically equivalent) this Unifiable Object with the parameter Unifiable Object, given an existing set of Substitutions.

      • Methods inherited from interface rogel.io.fopl.Expression

        replaceVariables, standardizeVariablesApart

    • Method Detail

      • unify

        Substitution unify(Unifiable unifiable,
                 Substitution substitution)
        Attempts to find the Substitution that unifies (makes syntactically equivalent) this Unifiable Object with the parameter Unifiable Object, given an existing set of Substitutions. If no such Substitution exists, this method returns null.

        This method is commutative: calling u1.unify(u2, s) is equivalent to calling u2.unify(u1, s).

        Parameters:
        unifiable - the Object to attempt to unify with, not null.
        substitution - the existing set of Substitutions to work with, not null.
        Returns:
        a Substitution that unifies this Object with the parameter Unifiable, or null if no Substitution exists.

      • containsVariable

        boolean containsVariable(Variable variable,
                       Substitution substitution)
        Checks to see if this Unifiable expression contains the parameter Variable, given an existing set of Substitutions (which may involve the Variable to check for). This method accomplishes what is colloquially referred to as the "occurs check" during unification.
        Parameters:
        variable - the Variable to check for, not null.
        substitution - the existing set of Substitutions to work with, not null.
        Returns:
        true if this Unifiable Object contains the Variable, false otherwise.
